newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU TO RULE TODAY ON MAIZE BIDS FOR NORTH KOREA.
newsitem.headline: EU TO RULE TODAY ON MAIZE BIDS FOR NORTH KOREA.

text.p: A European Union food aid tender for North Korea is expected to be settled by the end of the day, traders said on Wednesday.
Traders had bid on Tuesday to supply 24,000 tonnes of bagged or bulk maize for urgent delivery to the famine-stricken country under a relief effort mounted by the U.N. World Food Programme.

The maize, probably from last year's French harvest, is due to be loaded by September 7. Delays beyond then would attract penalties to speed up delivery and prevent speculation between the old and new European crops.
EU officials declined to comment on the progress of the tender, saying results would not be published until August 19.
Recent drought has devastated the maize harvest in North Korea, sharply worsening food shortages caused by two years of floods.
The drought of over 60 days destroyed 1.5 million tonnes of maize which the country had expected would help cover its needs between November 1997 and October 1998.
